DataElement.preferredName: Intervention Negative Therapeutic Effect Tantrum Intensity Intensity Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric code to represent the degree to which an individual experiences an increase in tantrums attributed to the study medication.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Intervention or Procedure Negative Therapeutic Effect Tantrum Intensity
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population.  This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmnetal acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects._Negative; involving disadvantage or harm._Therapeutic Effect; a drug's intended effect or result._The time period between the beginning of infancy and the end of adolescence._Not controlled, regulated, or constrained._Excessively affected by emotion._Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent._The degree or magnitude of strength, energy, or feeling.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A particular course of action intended to achieve a result.

Concepts.definition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.

Property.preferredName: Negative Therapeutic Effect Childhood Uncontrolled Emotional Response Intensity
Property.preferredDefinition: Negative; involving disadvantage or harm.:Therapeutic Effect; a drug's intended effect or result.:The time period between the beginning of infancy and the end of adolescence.:Not controlled, regulated, or constrained.:Excessively affected by emotion.:Response; a bodily process occurring due to the effect of some foregoing stimulus or agent.:The degree or magnitude of strength, energy, or feeling.

Concepts.definition: Beneficial responses or outcomes in the prevention, treatment, or progression of a disease resulting from treatment intervention. Therapeutic effect includes prevention or reduction of adverse effects. (NCI)
A time period that begins at the beginning of the human embryonic stage and continues until the end of adolescence.
Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.
The degree or magnitude of strength, energy, or feeling.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The degree or magnitude of strength, energy, or feeling._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.: An indication that a person has a condition or disease.  Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain.

Concepts.definition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.
Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not severe or strong; far from extreme; not serious enough to endanger life.: An indication that a person has a condition or disease.  Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain.

Concepts.definition: Gentle or temperate in nature or degree.
Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The quality of being within reasonable or average limits; not excessive or extreme.: An indication that a person has a condition or disease.  Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain.

Concepts.definition: The quality of being within reasonable or average limits; not excessive or extreme.
Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Intensely or extremely bad or unpleasant in degree, quality, or extent; life threatening.: An indication that a person has a condition or disease.  Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain.

Concepts.definition: Intensely bad or unpleasant in degree, quality or extent.
Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The degree or magnitude of strength, energy, or feeling.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: The degree or magnitude of strength, energy, or feeling.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
